author: iopq
body:
For now. Because Zen 3 isn't out. What happens when Zen 3 wins almost every benchmark (including games) and comes in at $200 for a 6 core? It means price cuts

As an investment it's doing poorly. I don't know about you, but up 3% over the last year doesn't seem good. It competes with several companies. I will list their competition

AMD: up 94% since a year ago

TSM: up 57% since a year ago

It's going to try to compete with NVDA as well, which is also up 134% since a year ago

You could literally throw a dart at hardware and do better

MU: 12%

SNPS: 46%

ASML: 67%

Literally any company I follow outperformed Intel. Micron is the only one that kind of sucks as well

body:
Wow, the growth on SNPS is crazy. I'll admit I never even heard of them before.

I like TSM. Keep adding to my position

author: borntoperform
body:
I've been bullish on TTD since 2018. Advertising will always be around as long as businesses exist. And since everything is moving more and more online, digital advertising will be here to stay. The Trade Desk own digital advertising.

I have other ones that I personally like, but I don't hold as strong opinions on them as I do TTD.

SNPS is something I have 5% of my holdings in.

FSLY was recommended to be back in the winter, and I wish I pulled the trigger back then when it was less than $20/share, but I got in at $45, and now wish I put more in.

SQ is a very long play, like 3-5 years. 

STNE is also a long play, they're payment processors specifically in Brazil, and it seems like they own that market down there. I don't expect them to be multi-baggers in 2 years, but it would surprise me if they're multi-baggers in 5 years.

author: Dingaling015
body:
Just a few I've come across so far:

DLPN - public offering ends tomorrow, ER expected by end of next week or sooner, already getting pumped by Yates though so caution here.

EROS - Rumored merger announcement with STX, recently been approved so we're all just waiting for a PR. It's already run up quite though (again thanks to Yates lol) so who knows.

There's also CHFS which has been well enough talked about here but I did not buy so do your own DD. There are also several other COVID plays that people have been talking about but hardly any volume to merit a second look.

But yeah this week's been meh.

author: Rossoneri
body:
>  this sub has really rejected the potential of this stock for no reason

The reason is that it's got 40M in market cap.  It's a tiny company that does a tiny amount of business.  Your list of "partners" paints an overly optimistic picture when it's really more of a list of "people who buy their products and people who sell products to them".  The build some specialty computing, nothing really groundbreaking here. 

Also "Puma" is one of their brands, it's not their partner.  They might be an interesting company, but the shilling and misleading posts indicate that they are closer to being pump & dump than real quality.

-----------------------------------------------

**For comparison:**

**broadberry.com** Partners: toshiba, seagate, intel, amd, windows, nvidia

**dihuni.com** Partners: lockheed, duke, intel, johns hopkins, NASA, US Navy, FDA, UCIrvine, UCSF

**abmx.com** Partners: microsoft, redhat, western digital, intel, supermicro, vmware, ubuntu

If anybody claims a company has a "partnership" without showing the contract details.  Ignore them.

author: RichardCabeza
body:
Yep they installed back doors on huawei, which is actually one if the reasons they pulled out of the US in 2014.

According to the report, the NSA has planted backdoors to access computers, hard drives, routers, and other devices from companies such as Cisco, Dell, Western Digital, Seagate, Maxtor, Samsung, and Huawei.

https://www.spiegel.de/international/world/catalog-reveals-nsa-has-back-doors-for-numerous-devices-a-940994.html

author: RichardCabeza
body:
So your point is spying on your own people isnbad but nothing compared to a country using its supply chain to spy on the world right?

You do know that we spied on our allies including tapping Merkel's phone right?

Heres a quote from Spiegel on the snowden report

NSA has planted backdoors to access computers, hard drives, routers, and other devices from companies such as Cisco, Dell, Western Digital, Seagate, Maxtor, Samsung, and Huawei.

https://www.spiegel.de/international/world/catalog-reveals-nsa-has-back-doors-for-numerous-devices-a-940994.html

Do you not know about this and snowden?  Like seriously?

And idk how you can make the comment theres no longer back doors.  Its like oh weve only done it 3 or 4 times but for reals weve stopped now.

author: KnightAnthony
body: Lol, there's a funny and profitable story regarding this company. I had very little idea about this one until I began looking into streaming choices due to COVID stay-at-home orders! I'm a cable cord cutter, but family wanted entertainment. So I compared mainly Netflix with Amazon, but research led me to study Roku.....and only for the remote control ability! I had a great experience with Seagate, and this Roku was giving me a similar vibe. So I took a gamble and bought 150 shares in one of my "forget-it-about" brokerage accounts. $10K is usually my starting investment, and I got it around $72 back in March. Again....TOTAL speculation and totally forgot I owned it! And if it weren't for some chatter about it yesterday, I would never had known how much it had appreciated. Lol, my PT was only $100, but when I saw that it was $150, I sold it all! Doubled my money in just a few months on something I wasn't expecting much. Might get back into it, but ROKU is not something I "love" so will have to think about it.

author: TheSuper_Namek
body: Eros will be probably announce ER after Netflix dropped theirs, eros is like the bollywood Netflix with their Eros now platform and eh they just got  approval from indian goverment to merge with STX entertainment  that is a Hollywood filmmaker they are going international after the merger  and they are dirt cheap right now.. company has potential but management doesn't seem to care about the shareholders

author: minawarr
body:
I grew up on bollywood movies and we are a bollywood household I will say. Eros has dwindled out of being one of the large production houses in India. The last hit movie it produced was in 2015 (bajirao mastani). I cant even recall any new bollywood music they have produced. 

I enjoyed watching the Eros entertainment banner when I was younger, but the scene is alot more competitive than it used to be in India in the 80s and 90s. All the top actors have launched their own production houses and tseries basically rules the music rights. 

I'm not sure how the STX merger will pan out. STX is more of a indie based company and  Indians enjoy over the top extravagant movies. Most indie productions don't bring in the box office numbers.

author: Various_Art
body:
These are my predictions do something near it. 
Buy CRESY @ $3.61. An agricultural stock from some South American Country (Argentina). Agriculture is automated and if they are about to be hungry I would prefer you donate the gains to South America.
This would be 27.7K shares. If it gains 125% in the next 6 months due to famine you can do well. Also if it reaches $12.5 you can make $346,250. You should obviously diversify.
TWLO ~$313  Dec. 21, 2020.

BEEEG YOLO RISK

Anytime you write a contract called an option you have unlimited risk. DO NOT WRITE A CONTRACT. 

You will be purchasing a contract. You want something that is out of the money going into the money meaning, it won't look like it is about to make money before the strike date.

Currently I would suggest a CALL option. I will leave some predictions below for most likely to succeed. You need to buy a few things to get 

MMM ~$179 Oct. 30, 2020
SPY ~$336 Nov. 13, 2020
COST ~$340 Oct 16, 2020


BEEG Mooon Strat

STX Call Option ~$60 Nov. 13, 2020
CACC Call Option ~$555 Aug. 21, 2020
FOX Call Option ~$35 Jan. 1, 2021
BBBY Call Option ~$25 Nov. 25, 2020


Safe Bet 

TL;DR - I suggest a straight purchase of shares.  
Such as: JPM @ 99.73 7/15. Hold for 25% gain, unfortunately leaves you at $125,000. 

Whatever you do pick something with positive net income for at least 3 years. Has a minimum of 5 M volume or similar Blue chip qualities.
